post.description: Restarts an Elasticsearch Resource. If a Resource is active: this command re-applies the existing plan but applies a "cluster_reboot", which issues a restart command and waits for it to complete. If a Resource is inactive: this command starts it up with the most recent successful plan.

parameters.name: deployment_id
parameters.description: Identifier for the Deployment.

parameters.name: ref_id
parameters.description: User-specified RefId for the Resource.

parameters.name: restore_snapshot
parameters.description: When set to true and restoring from shutdown, then will restore the cluster from the last snapshot (if available).

parameters.name: skip_snapshot
parameters.description: If true, will not take a snapshot of the cluster before restarting.

parameters.name: cancel_pending
parameters.description: If true, cancels any pending plans before restarting. If false and there are pending plans, returns an error.

parameters.name: group_attribute
parameters.description: Indicates the property or properties used to divide the list of instances to restart in groups. Valid options are: '\_\_all\_\_' (restart all at once), '\_\_zone\_\_' by logical zone, '\_\_name\_\_' one instance at a time, or a comma-separated list of attributes of the instances

parameters.name: shard_init_wait_time
parameters.description: The time, in seconds, to wait for shards that show no progress of initializing, before rolling the next group (default: 10 minutes)

202.description: The restart command was issued successfully.

get.description: By default, retrieves only the available Elastic Stack versions. To retrieve all of the Elastic Stack versions, use the `show_deleted parameter`.

parameters.name: show_deleted
parameters.description: Whether to show deleted stack versions or not

parameters.name: show_unusable
parameters.description: Whether to show versions that are unusable by the authenticated user

200.description: The list of all available Elastic Stack versions are retrieved, including the template version and structure.

ref_id.description: The reference id of the resource in the given deployment

AbsoluteRefId.description: A reference to a specific resource of a deployment

trust_all.description: If true, all clusters in this account will by default be trusted and the `trust_whitelist` is ignored.

trust_whitelist.description: The list of clusters to trust. Only used when `trust_all` is false.

AccountTrustRelationship.description: The trust relationship with the clusters of one account.

from.description: The allocator id off which all instances in the cluster should be moved

to.description: An optional list of allocator ids to which the instance(s) should be moved. If not specified then any available allocator can be used (including the current one if it is healthy)

allocator_down.description: Tells the infrastructure that all instances on the allocator should be considered as permanently down when deciding how to migrate data to new nodes. If left blank then the system will auto-decide (currently: will treat the allocator as up)

AllocatorMoveRequest.description: As part of the upgrade plan, identifies the move requests for the Kibana instances or APM Servers on the allocators.

display_name.description: The human readable name (defaults to the generated cluster id if not specified)

elasticsearch_cluster_ref_id.description: The user-specified id of the Elasticsearch Cluster that this will link to

Apm.description: Holds diagnostics for an APM resource

version.description: The version of the Apm cluster (must be one of the ECE supported versions, and won't work unless it matches the APM version. Leave blank to auto-detect version.)

docker_image.description: A docker URI that allows overriding of the default docker image specified for this version

user_settings_json.description: An arbitrary JSON object allowing (non-admin) cluster owners to set their parameters (only one of this and 'user_settings_yaml' is allowed), provided they are on the whitelist ('user_settings_whitelist') and not on the blacklist ('user_settings_blacklist'). (This field together with 'user_settings_override*' and 'system_settings' defines the total set of Apm settings)

user_settings_yaml.description: An arbitrary YAML object allowing (non-admin) cluster owners to set their parameters (only one of this and 'user_settings_json' is allowed), provided they are on the whitelist ('user_settings_whitelist') and not on the blacklist ('user_settings_blacklist'). (These field together with 'user_settings_override*' and 'system_settings' defines the total set of Apm settings)

user_settings_override_json.description: An arbitrary JSON object allowing ECE admins owners to set clusters' parameters (only one of this and 'user_settings_override_yaml' is allowed), ie in addition to the documented 'system_settings'. (This field together with 'system_settings' and 'user_settings*' defines the total set of Apm settings)

user_settings_override_yaml.description: An arbitrary YAML object allowing ECE admins owners to set clusters' parameters (only one of this and 'user_settings_override_json' is allowed), ie in addition to the documented 'system_settings'. (This field together with 'system_settings' and 'user_settings*' defines the total set of Apm settings)

ApmConfiguration.description: The configuration options for the APM Server.

apm_id.description: For an operation creating or updating an APM server, the Id of that server

secret_token.description: The secret token for accessing the server

diagnostics.description: If the endpoint is called with URL param 'validate_only=true', then this contains advanced debug info (the internal plan representation)

ApmCrudResponse.description: The response to an APM CRUD (create/update-plan) request.

id.description: The id of the APM

deployment_id.description: The id of the deployment that this APM Server belongs to.

healthy.description: Whether the APM is healthy or not (one or more of the info subsections will have healthy: false)

external_links.description: External resources related to the APM

links.description: A map of application-specific operations (which map to 'operationId's in the Swagger API) to metadata about that operation

settings.description: The cluster metadata settings for the APM

region.description: The region that this APM belongs to. Only populated in SaaS or federated ECE.

ApmInfo.description: The overview information for the APM Server.

ref_id.description: A locally-unique user-specified id for APM

elasticsearch_cluster_ref_id.description: Alias to the Elasticsearch Cluster to attach APM to

display_name.description: The human readable name for the APM cluster (default: takes the name of its Elasticsearch cluster)

region.description: The region where this resource exists

settings.description: The settings for building this APM cluster

ApmPayload.description: An APM creation request paired with the alias of the Elasticsearch cluster it should be paired with

ApmPlan.description: The plan for the APM Server.

timeout.description: The total timeout in seconds after which the plan is cancelled even if it is not complete. Defaults to 4x the max memory capacity per node (in MB)

calm_wait_time.description: This timeout determines how long to give a cluster after it responds to API calls before performing actual operations on it. It defaults to 5s

extended_maintenance.description: If true (default false), does not clear the maintenance flag (which prevents its API from being accessed except by the constructor) on new instances added until after a snapshot has been restored, otherwise, the maintenance flag is cleared once the new instances successfully join the new cluster

cluster_reboot.description: Set to 'forced' to force a reboot as part of the upgrade plan

ApmPlanControlConfiguration.description: The plan control configuration options for the APM Server.

plan_attempt_id.description: A UUID for each plan attempt

A structure that defines a curated subset of the APM Server settings. 
TIP: To define the complete set of APM Server setting, use `ApmSystemSettings` with `user_settings_override_` and `user_settings_`.

version.description: The version of the AppSearch cluster (must be one of the ECE supported versions, and won't work unless it matches the Elasticsearch version. Leave blank to auto-detect version.)

user_settings_json.description: An arbitrary JSON object allowing (non-admin) cluster owners to set their parameters (only one of this and 'user_settings_yaml' is allowed), provided they are on the whitelist ('user_settings_whitelist') and not on the blacklist ('user_settings_blacklist'). (This field together with 'user_settings_override*' and 'system_settings' defines the total set of AppSearch settings)

user_settings_yaml.description: An arbitrary YAML object allowing (non-admin) cluster owners to set their parameters (only one of this and 'user_settings_json' is allowed), provided they are on the whitelist ('user_settings_whitelist') and not on the blacklist ('user_settings_blacklist'). (These field together with 'user_settings_override*' and 'system_settings' defines the total set of AppSearch settings)

user_settings_override_json.description: An arbitrary JSON object allowing ECE admins owners to set clusters' parameters (only one of this and 'user_settings_override_yaml' is allowed), ie in addition to the documented 'system_settings'. (This field together with 'system_settings' and 'user_settings*' defines the total set of AppSearch settings)

user_settings_override_yaml.description: An arbitrary YAML object allowing ECE admins owners to set clusters' parameters (only one of this and 'user_settings_override_json' is allowed), ie in addition to the documented 'system_settings'. (This field together with 'system_settings' and 'user_settings*' defines the total set of AppSearch settings)

user_settings_override_yaml.description: An arbitrary YAML object allowing ECE admins owners to set clusters' parameters (only one of this and 'user_settings_override_json' is allowed), ie in addition to the documented 'system_settings'. NOTES: (This field together with 'system_settings' and 'user_settings*' defines the total set of Elasticsearch settings)

enabled_built_in_plugins.description: A list of plugin names from the Elastic-supported subset that are bundled with the version images. NOTES: (Users should consult the Elastic stack objects to see what plugins are available, this is currently only available from the UI)

user_plugins.description: A list of admin-uploaded plugin objects that are available for this user.

user_bundles.description: A list of admin-uploaded bundle objects (eg scripts, synonym files) that are available for this user.

curation.description: Defines the index curation routing for the cluster

node_attributes.description: Defines the Elasticsearch node attributes for the instances in the topology

ElasticsearchConfiguration.description: The Elasticsearch cluster settings. When specified at the top level, provides a field-by-field default. When specified at the topology level, provides the override settings.

ElasticsearchCuration.description: The structure that defines the routing settings for index curation.

id.description: The id of the orphaned resource

ElasticsearchDependant.description: Details about an orphaned Elasticsearch-dependent resources.

username.description: The username for the newly-reset password for the given Elasticsearch cluster

password.description: The newly-reset password for the given Elasticsearch cluster

ElasticsearchElasticUserPasswordResetRes.description: Envelope holding the newly-reset password for a cluster's user

healthy.description: Whether the Elasticsearch cluster is healthy (check the sub-objects for more details if not)

master_node_id.description: The Elasticsearch node id of a master node

master_instance_name.description: The corresponding instance name of the container hosting the Elasticsearch master node, if available

instances.description: The names of the instance/container hosting the node belong to the cluster with the given master

ElasticsearchMasterElement.description: Information about the Elasticsearch instances. For split-brain cases, this also includes sub-clusters.

healthy.description: Whether the master situation in the cluster is healthy (ie is the number of masters != 1), or do any instances have no master

instances_with_no_master.description: A list of any instances with no master

ElasticsearchMasterInfo.description: Information about the master nodes in the Elasticsearch cluster.

healthy.description: Whether the Monitoring configuration has been successfully applied

last_modified.description: The time the monitoring configuration was last changed

last_update_status.description: The status message from the last update (successful or not)

source_cluster_ids.description: The list of clusters Ids from which this cluster is currently receiving monitoring data

destination_cluster_ids.description: The list of clusters Ids to which this cluster is currently sending monitoring data

ElasticsearchMonitoringInfo.description: Information about the monitoring status for the Elasticsearch cluster.

master.description: Defines whether this node can be elected master (default: true)

data.description: Defines whether this node can hold data (default: true)

ingest.description: Defines whether this node can run an ingest pipeline (default: true)

ml.description: Defines whether this node can run ml jobs, valid only for versions 5.4.0 or greater (default: false)

ElasticsearchNodeType.description: Controls the combinations of Elasticsearch node types. TIP: By default, the Elasticsearch node is master eligible, can hold data, and run ingest pipelines. WARNING: Do not set for tiebreaker topologies.

ref_id.description: A locally-unique user-specified id for this Elasticsearch cluster

display_name.description: The human readable name for the cluster (defaults to the generated cluster id if not specified)

region.description: The region where this resource exists

plan.description: The plan for building this Elasticsearch cluster

settings.description: The settings for building this Elasticsearch cluster

ElasticsearchPayload.description: An alias for an Elasticsearch Cluster paired with a request for creating one

timeout.description: The total timeout in seconds after which the plan is cancelled even if it is not complete. Defaults to 4x the max memory capacity per node (in MB). NOTES: A 3 zone cluster with 2 nodes of 2048 each would have a timeout of 4*2048=8192 seconds. Timeout does not include time required to run rollback actions.

calm_wait_time.description: This timeout determines how long to give a cluster after it responds to API calls before performing actual operations on it. It defaults to 5s

skip_snapshot.description: If true (default: false), does not take (or require) a successful snapshot to be taken before performing any potentially destructive changes to this cluster

max_snapshot_attempts.description: If taking a snapshot (ie unless 'skip_snapshots': true) then will retry on failure at most this number of times (default: 5)

max_snapshot_age.description: When you take a snapshot and 'skip_snapshots' is false, specifies the maximum age in seconds of the most recent snapshot before a new snapshot is created. Default is 300

extended_maintenance.description: If true (default false), does not clear the maintenance flag (which prevents its API from being accessed except by the constructor) on new instances added until after a snapshot has been restored, otherwise, the maintenance flag is cleared once the new instances successfully join the new cluster

cluster_reboot.description: Set to 'forced' to force a reboot as part of the upgrade plan. NOTES: (ie taking an existing plan and leaving it alone except for setting 'transient.plan_configuration.cluster_reboot': 'forced' will reboot the cluster)

ElasticsearchPlanControlConfiguration.description: The configuration settings for the timeout and fallback parameters.

instance_name.description: The Elastic Cloud name/id of the instance (container)

replica_count.description: The number of unavailable replicas on this instance

ElasticsearchReplicaElement.description: Information about the unavailable replicas. NOTE: Unlike shards, unavailable replicas indicate a loss of redundancy rather than a loss of availability.

ref_id.description: The locally-unique user-specified id of a Resource

id.description: The randomly-generated id of a Resource

region.description: The region where this resource exists

ElasticsearchResourceInfo.description: Describes an Elasticsearch resource belonging to a Deployment

enabled.description: If enabled (default: true) then scripts are enabled, either for sandboxing languages (by default), or for all installed languages if 'sandbox_mode' is disabled (or for 6.x). NOTES: (Corresponds to the parameter 'script.file|stored/indexed|inline')

sandbox_mode.description: If enabled (default: true) and this script type is enabled, then only the sandbox languages are allowed. By default the sandbox languages are painless, expressions and mustache, but this can be restricted via the 'painless_enabled', 'mustache_enabled' 'expression_enabled' settings.NOTES: Not supported in 6.x. (Corresponds to the parameters 'script.engine.[painless|mustache|expressions].[file|stored|inline]')

ElasticsearchScriptTypeSettings.description: Enables scripting for the specified type and controls other parameters. Store scripts in indexes (`stored`), upload in file bundles (`file`), or use in API requests (`inline`).

painless_enabled.description: (5.x+ only) If enabled (the default) then the painless scripting engine is allowed as a sandboxed language. Sandboxed languages are the only ones allowed if 'sandbox_mode' is set to true. NOTES: (Corresponds to the parameters 'script.engine.painless.[file|stored|inline]')

mustache_enabled.description: (5.x+ only) If enabled (the default) then the mustache scripting engine is allowed as a sandboxed language. Sandboxed languages are the only ones allowed if 'sandbox_mode' is set to true. NOTES: (Corresponds to the parameters 'script.engine.mustache.[file|stored|inline]')

expressions_enabled.description: (5.x+ only) If enabled (the default) then the expressions scripting engine is allowed as a sandboxed language. Sandboxed languages are the only ones allowed if 'sandbox_mode' is set to true. NOTES: (Corresponds to the parameters 'script.engine.expression.[file|stored|inline]')

ElasticsearchScriptingUserSettings.description: Controls the languages supported by the Elasticsearch cluster, such as Painless, Mustache, and Expressions. Controls how the languages are used, such as file, index, and inline. TIP: For complex configurations, leave these blank and configure these settings in the user YAML or JSON.

instance_name.description: The Elastic Cloud name/id of the instance (container)

shard_count.description: The number of shards of the given type (available/unavailable) on this instance

ElasticsearchShardElement.description: Information about the shards for each Elasticsearch instance container that hosts an Elasticsearch node. TIP: When the shard is unavailable, the cluster is unable to serve all of the data.

healthy.description: Whether the shard situation is healthy (any unavailable shards is unhealthy)

ElasticsearchShardsInfo.description: Information about the shards and replicas that comprise the Elasticsearch indices.

reindex_whitelist.description: Limits remote Elasticsearch clusters that can be used as the source for '_reindex' API commands

use_disk_threshold.description: Whether to factor in the available disk space on a node before deciding whether to allocate new shards to that node or actively relocate shards away from the node (default: true). NOTES: (Corresponds to the parameter 'cluster.routing.allocation.disk.threshold_enabled')

auto_create_index.description: If true (the default), then any write operation on an index that does not currently exist will create it. NOTES: (Corresponds to the parameter 'action.auto_create_index')

enable_close_index.description: Defaults to false on versions <= 7.2.0, true otherwise. If false, then the API commands to close indices are disabled. This is important because Elasticsearch does not snapshot or migrate close indices on versions under 7.2.0, therefore standard Elastic Cloud configuration operations will cause irretrievable loss of indices' data. NOTES: (Corresponds to the parameter 'cluster.indices.close.enable')

destructive_requires_name.description: If true (default is false) then the index deletion API will not support wildcards or '_all'. NOTES: (Corresponds to the parameter 'action.destructive_requires_name')

watcher_trigger_engine.description: The trigger engine for Watcher, defaults to 'scheduler' - see the xpack documentation for more information. NOTES: (Corresponds to the parameter '(xpack.)watcher.trigger.schedule.engine', depending on version. Ignored from 6.x onwards.)

default_shards_per_index.description: (2.x only - to get the same result in 5.x template mappings must be used) Sets the default number of shards per index, defaulting to 1 if not specified. (Corresponds to the parameter 'index.number_of_shards' in 2.x, not supported in 5.x)

monitoring_collection_interval.description: The default interval at which monitoring information from the cluster if collected, if monitoring is enabled. NOTES: (Corresponds to the parameter 'marvel.agent.interval' in 2.x and 'xpack.monitoring.collection.interval' in 5.x)

monitoring_history_duration.description: The duration for which monitoring history is stored (format '(NUMBER)d' eg '3d' for 3 days). NOTES: ('Corresponds to the parameter xpack.monitoring.history.duration' in 5.x, defaults to '7d')

ElasticsearchSystemSettings.description: A subset of Elasticsearch settings. TIP: To define the complete set of Elasticsearch settings, use `ElasticsearchSystemSettings` with `user_settings_override*` and `user_settings*`.

(This field together with 'user_settings_override*' and 'system_settings' defines the total set of Enterprise Search settings)

RestoreSnapshotRepoConfiguration.description: Configures the location of a remote repository. The default is the system repository.

RollingGrowShrinkStrategyConfig.description: A strategy that creates new Elasticsearch instances, Kibana instances, and APM Servers with the new plan, then migrates the node data to minimize the amount of spare capacity.

group_by.description: Specifies the grouping attribute to use when rolling several instances. Instances that share the same value for the provided attribute key are rolled together as a unit. Examples that make sense to use are '\_\_all\_\_' (roll all instances as a single unit), 'logical_zone_name' (roll instances by zone), '\_\_name\_\_' (roll one instance at a time, the default if not specified). Note that '\_\_all\_\_' is required when performing a major version upgrade

allow_inline_resize.description: Whether we allow changing the capacity of instances (default false). This is currently implemented by stopping, re-creating then starting the affected instance on its associated allocator when performing the changes. NOTES: This requires a round-trip through the allocation infrastructure of the active constructor, as it has to reserve the target capacity without over-committing

skip_synced_flush.description: Whether to skip attempting to do a synced flush on the filesystem of the container (default: false), which is less safe but may be required if the container is unhealthy

shard_init_wait_time.description: The time, in seconds, to wait for shards that show no progress of initializing before rolling the next group (default: 10 minutes)

RollingStrategyConfig.description: Performs inline, rolling configuration changes that mutate existing containers. TIP: This is the fastest way to update a plan, but can fail for complex plan changes, such as topology changes. Also, this is less safe for configuration changes that leave a cluster in a non running state. NOTE: When you perform a major version upgrade, and 'group_by' is set to 'pass:macros[__all__]';, rolling is required.

TransientApmPlanConfiguration.description: Defines the configuration parameters that control how the plan is applied. For example, the Elasticsearch cluster topology and APM Server settings.

TransientAppSearchPlanConfiguration.description: Defines configuration parameters that control how the plan (ie consisting of the cluster topology and AppSearch settings) is applied

remote_clusters.description: The list of resources that will be configured as remote clusters

cluster_settings_json.description:
If specified, contains transient settings to be applied to an Elasticsearch cluster during changes, default values shown below applied.
These can be overridden by specifying them in the map (or null to unset). Additional settings can also be set. Settings will be cleared after the plan has finished. If not specified, no settings will be applied.
NOTE: These settings are only explicitly cleared for 5.x+ clusters, they must be hand-reset to their defaults in 2.x- (or a cluster reboot will clear them).
- indices.store.throttle.max_bytes_per_sec: 150Mb
- indices.recovery.max_bytes_per_sec: 150Mb
- cluster.routing.allocation.cluster_concurrent_rebalance: 10
- cluster.routing.allocation.node_initial_primaries_recoveries: 8
- cluster.routing.allocation.node_concurrent_incoming_recoveries: 8

TransientElasticsearchPlanConfiguration.description: Defines the configuration parameters that control how the plan is applied. For example, the Elasticsearch cluster topology and Elasticsearch settings.

TransientEnterpriseSearchPlanConfigurati.description: Defines configuration parameters that control how the plan (i.e. consisting of the cluster topology and Enterprise Search settings) is applied

TransientKibanaPlanConfiguration.description: Defines the configuration parameters that control how the plan is applied. For example, the Elasticsearch cluster topology and Kibana instance settings.
